title: Schema for cell object
description: A group of tables comprises a set of annotated tables and a set of annotations that relate to that group of tables.
$comment: Model for tabular data and metadata, Section 4.5 Cells.

aboutURL.description: an absolute URL for the entity about which this cell provides information, or null.

column.description: the column in which the cell appears; the cell must be in the cells for that column.

errors.description: a (possibly empty) list of validation errors generated while parsing the value of the cell.

ordered.description: a boolean that, if the value of this cell is a list, indicates whether the order of that list should be preserved or not.

propertyURL.description: an absolute URL for the property associated with this cell, or null.

row.description: the row in which the cell appears; the cell must be in the cells for that row.

stringValue.description: a string that is the original syntactic representation of the value of the cell, e.g. how the cell appears within a CSV file; this may be an empty string.

table.description: the table in which the cell appears.

textDirection.description: which direction the text within the cell should be displayed, as described in section 6.5.1 Bidirectional Tables; the value of this annotation may be derived from the table direction annotation on the table, if the textDirection property is set to inherit (the default).

value.description: the semantic value of the cell; this may be a list of values, each of which may have a datatype other than a string, may have a language and may be null. For example, annotations might enable a processor to understand the string value of the cell as representing a number or a date. By default, if the string value is an empty string, the semantic value of the cell is null.

valueURL.description: an absolute URL for this cell's value, or null.
